bug.author: pdstc
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Please state the information for your system</denchmark-h>
OpenCV version: 3.1.0 Host OS: Linux (Ubuntu 14.04) / Mac OS X 10.11.3 Compiler & CMake: GCC 4.8.4 & CMake 2.8.12.2 / AppleClang 7.0.2.7000181 & CMake 3.5.0 CUDA: 7.5
<denchmark-h:h3>In which part of the OpenCV library you got the issue?</denchmark-h>
stitching cpp-example-stitching, cpp-example-stitching_detailed
<denchmark-h:h3>Issue</denchmark-h>
On both Linux and OSX stitcher examples crash when gpu is enabled. <denchmark-h:h3>Code example to reproduce the issue / Steps to reproduce the issue</denchmark-h>
Linux: <denchmark-code>build/bin/cpp-example-stitching ~/Downloads/k1.jpg ~/Downloads/k2.jpg --try_use_gpu yes OpenCV Error: The function/feature is not implemented (You should explicitly call download method for cuda::GpuMat object) in getMat_, file /home/paul/opencv/opencv/modules/core/src/matrix.cpp, line 1224 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'cv::Exception' what(): /home/paul/opencv/opencv/modules/core/src/matrix.cpp:1224: error: (-213) You should explicitly call download method for cuda::GpuMat object in function getMat_
Aborted (core dumped) </denchmark-code>
OSX: <denchmark-code>bin/cpp-example-stitching ~/Downloads/k1.jpg ~/Downloads/k2.jpg --try_use_gpu yes OpenCV Error: The function/feature is not implemented (You should explicitly call download method for cuda::GpuMat object) in getMat_, file /Users/paul/work/opencv/opencv_git/modules/core/src/matrix.cpp, line 1224 libc++abi.dylib: terminating with uncaught exception of type cv::Exception: /Users/paul/work/opencv/opencv_git/modules/core/src/matrix.cpp:1224: error: (-213) You should explicitly call download method for cuda::GpuMat object in function getMat_
Abort trap: 6 </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Same behaviour in Windows 8.1 x64, OpenCV 3.1.0 compiled from latest git with Cuda 7.5 using msvc2013: C:\OpenCV-3.1.0\opencv_build\bin\Release>cpp-example-stitching testdata\stitching\boat1.jpg testdata\stitching\boat2.jpg --try_use_gpu yes OpenCV Error: The function/feature is not implemented (You should explicitly call download method for cuda::GpuMat object) in cv::InputArray::getMat, file C:\OpenCV-3.1.0\opencv\modules\core\src\matrix.cpp, line 1232

Apparently the bug is related to SURF estimator (I built OpenCV with contrib modules, including xfeatures2d). For me, launching cpp-example-stitching_detailed.exe testdata\stitching\boat1.jpg testdata\stitching\boat2.jpg --try_cuda yes crashes with the above error message, but using orb feature detector works fine: cpp-example-stitching_detailed.exe testdata\stitching\boat1.jpg testdata\stitching\boat2.jpg --try_cuda yes --features orb My stack trace when using the standard SURF detector: opencv_core310.dll!cv::error(const cv::Exception & exc) Line 653 C++ opencv_core310.dll!cv::error(int _code, const cv::String & _err, const char * _func, const char * _file, int _line) Line 658 C++ opencv_core310.dll!cv::InputArray::getMat(int i) Line 1232 C++ opencv_imgproc310.dll!cv::_InputArray::getMat(int i) Line 128 C++ opencv_imgproc310.dll!cv::cvtColor(const cv::_InputArray & _src, const cv::_OutputArray & _dst, int code, int dcn) Line 7933 C++ opencv_stitching310.dll!cv::detail::SurfFeaturesFinderGpu::find(const cv::_InputArray & image, cv::detail::ImageFeatures & features) Line 485 C++ opencv_stitching310.dll!cv::detail::FeaturesFinder::operator()(const cv::_InputArray & image, cv::detail::ImageFeatures & features) Line 282 C++ cpp-example-stitching_detailed.exe!main(int argc, char * * argv) Line 447 C++
Same behaviour in Linux Mint 18.0 (Ubuntu 16.04 LTS), OpenCV 3.1 + contrib + Cuda 7.5 compiled with GCC 5.4.0

There is a bug in the implementation at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/bf4c5bef7fa254e996f31d3e3d7f81ce63716c13/modules/stitching/src/matchers.cpp#L483>this line</denchmark-link> . void SurfFeaturesFinderGpu::find(InputArray image, ImageFeatures &features); GpuMats has been used in cvtColor function directly. Please replace this line cvtColor(image_, gray_image_, COLOR_BGR2GRAY); with: <denchmark-code> Mat gray_image; //MEER TEMPORARY STORAGE FOR GRAY IMAGE cvtColor(image, gray_image, COLOR_BGR2GRAY); //MEER CREATE THE GRAY IMAGE gray_image_.upload(gray_image); //MEER SEND THE GRAY IMAGE TO GPU COUNTERPART </denchmark-code>
In case you need more explanation please visit <denchmark-link:https://sadeqbillah.wordpress.com/2017/03/09/solving-opencv-gpu-image-stitching-error/>my blog</denchmark-link>
